items.title: Upgrading name resolution
items.description: Deploying a new Universal Resolver will allow us to quickly switch all clients over to the new resolution process when the new L2 infrastructure is deployed. Deploying a new name resolution process is essential to support our new registry structure that will remove artifact subdomains from ENS when names are transferred or expire

items.title: L2 Reverse resolution
items.description: L2 reverse resolution needs to be L2 specific and this new ENSIP will standardise how this resolution will be done. Connecting the L2 reverse registrars to L1 requires a new CCIP-read gateway and contracts on each L2. The discovery process also needs to be enabled by the DAO via the root.

items.title: Write new contracts for L1 & L2
items.description: A new sub registry contract will be written to rearchitect what we have learnt from the last 7 years of ENS, improving the UX of artifact subdomains

items.title: Deploy ENS L2
items.description: This would involve setting up everything that ENS needs on an existing L2, or its own L2

items.title: Deploy initial contracts on L1 & L2
items.description: Initial registries, resolvers, registrars will be deployed

items.title: Sync registrations and renewals to ENS L2
items.description: Once contracts are deployed a sync process will initiate to sync data with the legacy contracts

items.title: Switch resolution process to new contracts
items.description: Universal resolver will switch to the new registries and begin using new infrastructure
